body.name: The Phantom Chase: A Chase Fulton Novel (Chase Fulton Novels Book 24)

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #4,101 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #6 in Sea Adventures Fiction (Kindle Store) #20 in Mystery Action Fiction (Kindle Store) #38 in Action Thriller Fiction

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars ACTION, Questions and Secrets, OH MY!
reviews.reviewText: Another awesome installment in this series. The team gets word that Americans are being held hostage by a Mexican Drug Cartel, along with a journalist who is attempting to “out” them. COVERTLY, even from the Board! They decide that the intel is credible enough to undertake this mission on their own with NO SUPPORT from the Board. Chase is determined to retire after this mission because he and Penny have a child on the way.There are lots of ups and downs during this mission that make the situation and rescue very fluid. The team is determined to have a positive outcome. Anya is brought in to train the team in knife fighting and joins the mission …. She seems to be harboring a secret from Chase and on many occasions attempts to tell him, but interruptions persist.As always, the action is non-stop, and the cliffhanger is tantalizing. Another winner for Cap!I’m one of Cap’s Beta Readers … the SLOW-READING ONE! After all these years, this man’s capacity for exciting, well-written storytelling is PHENOMENAL! I do pay for an additional copy in case I want to “trash” him ….. NOT AT ALL LIKELY because Cap is ALWAYS got his game on!Treat yourself to this FANTASTIC Chase Fulton novel.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars What a crazy ride
reviews.reviewText: I have found myself anxious, scared, excited and even heart broken throughout this series. I am still proud to find the main character living his life with a prosthetic as he would otherwise without one.I myself try to live by the same mantra. I am the same person, just shaped different. I may be handicapped, but I am not cripple. Like in golf you may play ranked handicap but you have to still play the whole game.The loss of the child is heartbreaking and I sincerely hope Chase and Penny get another shot at being parents.Like Anya said...with the burden of the knowledge that so much life has been lost at his hands, to experience the gift of creating life would somehow make it palatable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Chase and Retirement?
reviews.reviewText: Just another great story of the gang. Loved the involvement of Anya, physically involved in the plot. The baby part of the story was at least interesting and You did do a good job writing that through. Not sure If I had a better idea for an end to that part of the book. The basic story falls in line with most of the really good shoot em-ups that Cap has put together in the 23 books. I enjoyed this as much as all the others. I did make it all the way to the landing in Cano before I spent the rest of the night finishing the book. Like so many other people I am a huge fan! Great job!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Finally some action
reviews.reviewText: Several previous books were getting a little too sappy and cuddlyfor me, changing Chase's character. This had more action finally.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The best one yet
reviews.reviewText: I have read most, if not all, of this series. They are generally too goody two shoes for me but this one has death and destruction to taste. Thanks Cap see you soon!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars What an unexpected ending
reviews.reviewText: I have enjoyed all of Cap's books. Singer most of all. At book 24 in the Chase series I was completely surprised! I can’t wait for what comes next…

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Roller Coaster of a Read
reviews.reviewText: I’ve read each of the Chase Fulton novels, and they never fail to please. This one had me holding my breath at times and wiping tears away at others. It was an excellent book with several surprises. There’s lots of action, and of course the entire “family” played a role. I’ve become very attached to his team.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Devastating and beautiful
reviews.reviewText: I was riveted and horrified when the chopper Clark was flying was shot down. Like Chase, I lost all sense of humanity as I shared in Chases loss of self-control into barbarism. I fear I’d react the same way. Mongo shouting Clark’s alive, I actually screamed with joy and relief.Then heartbroken at the loss of the baby…. Anya’s sacrificing her liver (or part of) for Penny’s life reminded me just how precious life is. Thank you God for life❤️🙏Another fantastic adventure Cap!
Gut wrenching and sad but non stop action from start to finish and impossible to put down. Looking forward to the next book in this wonderful series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: great end to the year book
reviews.reviewText: what a story wasn't sure where was going near the end so was nice twist but worked out in end ,can't wait for 2024 hope there are plenty more story's to go still great characters great story's great read can't wait for more .
